definition[0]: a self-imposed rule, duty etc is one that you have made for yourself, and which no one has asked you to accept
example[0]: She spent five years in self-imposed exile in Bolivia.
definition[1]: a self-imposed rule, condition, or limit has been set by the people who must obey it, and does not have to be obeyed by anyone else
example[1]: Even with the approach of aself-imposed deadline, there was no clear sign of an agreement.
